siteBlocker.title: Privacy Policy for Site Blocker
siteBlocker.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how the Site Blocker Chrome extension collects, uses, stores, and protects user-defined URL patterns to block websites.
siteBlocker.dataCollected: Site Blocker does not collect any personally identifiable information. It stores only the URL patterns you specify to block sites.

permissions.storage: Access to Chrome Storage API for storing your URL patterns locally.
permissions.activeTab: Access to the active tab to determine which URL to block.
permissions.scripting: Use of Chrome Scripting API to inject blocking scripts on web pages.

siteBlocker.localStorage: All data is stored locally on your device using Chrome Storage Sync or Local, and is not shared externally.
siteBlocker.thirdParty: Site Blocker does not use or call any third-party services or analytics.
siteBlocker.changes: We may update this policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes via the extension update and update the effective date below.
siteBlocker.contact: If you have any questions about this policy, please contact us at hckapplications@gmail.com.
